data.title: Australian Film Television and Radio School
data.meta_description: Australia’s premier screen arts and broadcast school
data.meta_site_name: Australian Film Television and Radio School
data.text:
Tamara Meem is a film and television editor from Sydney, now based in Los Angeles. She has cut four feature films that premiered at the Sundance Film Festival: Sound of My Voice (2011), I Smile Back (2015), The Intervention (2016) and Wander Darkly (2020).

Tamara edited Olivia Newman’s debut feature, First Match, which won the Gamechanger award at SXSW in 2018. 2022 sees them collaborate once more on Apple TV+/ Hello Sunshine series The Last Thing He Told Me, with showrunner Josh Singer. Jennifer Garner acts and executive produces the New York Times No. 1 bestseller adaptation.

In 2021 Tamara brought to life the WeWork story, titled WeCrashed for Apple TV+ starring Jared Leto and Anne Hathaway. Other television credits include The Romanoffs and Mad Men for showrunner Matthew Weiner.

Tamara is known for sculpting fine performances, having edited productions starring Jared Leto, Anne Hathaway, Sienna Miller, Diego Luna, Melanie Lynskey, Sarah Silverman, Jennifer Garner, Yahya Abdul-Mateen II and many others.
